description: A fast breakdown of Electromagnetic Waves: The Spectrum for builders.

hook.text: Visible light is just a tiny sliver of the electromagnetic spectrum â€” there's so much more.

buildup.text: All electromagnetic waves travel at light speed but differ in wavelength and frequency.

discovery.text: From longest to shortest: radio, microwave, infrared, visible, ultraviolet, X-ray, gamma ray.

twist.text: Your eyes detect less than 0.0035% of the entire electromagnetic spectrum.

climax.text: We use every part: radio for music, microwaves for food, X-rays for bones, gamma for cancer treatment.

punchline.text: You see a sliver of reality. The rest is invisible waves carrying music and data.

quiz.question: What do all electromagnetic waves have in common?
options: They travel at the speed of light
They are visible to the human eye
They require a medium to travel through
